name: Things You've Probably Wondered About Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: In Bobby Darin's 'Mack the Knife' there is a reference to 'Miss Lotta Lenya'. Who was she?
questions.explanation:
Wife of Kurt Weill.

	She was an actress who was married (for a while) to Kurt Weill. Weill wrote 'Threepenny Opera' along with Brecht. It was based on Gay's 'Beggar's Opera'.

questions.text: A 'draconian' measurre is one that is extremely harsh. Who was Draco?
The game of chess is said to have originated in this country
Andersonville Prison, used by the Confederacy during the Civil War, is one of the most famous prisons in American history. Where was it located?
Who is credited with saying 'early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise'?
questions.explanation:
Ben Franklin.

	Poor Richard's Almanac. Also: 'God helps those who help themselves'

questions.text: The popular song, 'Old Folks at Home' contains a reference to 'way down upon the Swanee River'? Where is that river located?
questions.explanation:
Southeast.

	Suwannee River, actually. It's almost entirely in Florida

questions.text: What was the real name of Groucho Marx?
questions.explanation:
Julius.

	The other choices were the names of his brothers

Scandinavia.

	It's in Finland-Norway-Sweden, by the Arctic Circle

questions.text: The term 'Utopia' first appears in a book by the same name. Who is the author?
Which of these characters was NOT a real person?
options: The Man in the Iron Mask (by Dumas)
questions.explanation:
Sherlock Holmes (by Arthur Conan Doyle).

	Salieri was a real composer, but there isn't a lot of support for the notion that he destroyed Mozart with schemes, etc. The Man in the Iron Mask was, in fact, a prisoner in the Bastille his identity is still a mystery. Cardinal Richelieu was an actual person some centuries ago. Holmes, however, was fictional.
